titles.title: Withdrawing the approval of the United States from the Agreement establishing the World Trade Organization.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Committee Consideration and Mark-up Session Held.

committee.name: House Committee on Ways and Means
House Committee on Ways and Means

action.text: Reported adversely by the Committee on Ways and Means. H. Rept. 109-100.

calendar.text: Placed on the Union Calendar, Calendar No. 54.

action.text: Rules Committee Resolution H. Res. 304 Reported to House. Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 27 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
Considered under the provisions of rule H. Res. 304.

reference.label: text of measure as reported in House

action.text: Rule provides for consideration of H.J. Res. 27 with 2 hours of general debate. Previous question shall be considered as ordered without intervening motions. Measure will be considered read. Bill is closed to amendments.
GENERAL DEBATE - Pursuant to the provisions of H. Res. 304, the House proceeded with 2 hours of general debate on H.J. Res. 27.
The previous question was ordered pursuant to the rule.

vote.text: On passage Failed by the Yeas and Nays: 86 - 338, 1 Present (Roll no. 239).

action.text: Motion to reconsider laid on the table Agreed to without objection.

bill.summary: 5/26/2005--Reported to House without amendment. Declares that Congress withdraws its approval, provided under the Uruguay Round Agreements Act, establishing the World Trade Organization (WTO).
